result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul M Caleb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $368  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JD.

Visitation or placement to be arranged through 3rd party-until agent finds electronic contact appropriate.  Completion of certified domestic violence treatment.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes:
With huber.
10/17/14: Crt orders the def is to receive a total of 17 days sentence credit (prev 0)

supervisions.notes: Costs in the amount of $343 in Count #2 of Case #14CF501 to be collected by Dept of Corrections as a condition of probation in ct 1.

Reporter: Melanie Nelson
Defn has waived his appearance for this hearing. Atty Khandhar objects as to timliness of ADA Throckmorton's filing of articles.  ADA Throckmorton responds.  Ct believes the articles submitted are simply to meet the Daubert challenge and will allow consideration of these articles for purposes of this hearing only for Daubert determination.
As to expert testimony - counsel make arguments.  Ct grants 1, denies 2 and 3, and grants 4 - except as to 2 and 3.  As to other acts - counsel make arguements; Ct allows 3 incidents; June 14, 2004; 2006; 2012.  Juror questions will not be allowed.
